intro: Armeria elongata var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of white or pink flowers in spring. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and is well adapted to dry, rocky environments. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate blooms and hardy nature.
